page.title: 17POPULATION IN BILSTHORPE
page.content: The population of all Bilsthorpe at the latest count in 1981 was 3,191 a decline since 1971. Approx 438 people are of pensionable age, 14% of the population. The number of children under 14 is 779 nearly 25%. There is a nursery school attached to the Infant School where there are 100 children between 5 and 7 yrs old, 50 boys and 50 girls. At the Junior School there are 165 children between 8 and 11 yrs old, 87 boys and 78 girls. Most of the older children go to Rufford Comprehensive at Edwinstowe although there are some who go to the Minster School at Southwell. Of the 1200 men who work at the Mine only 35% live in Bilsthorpe. The 1981 census shows for housing, 471 owner occupied, 261 council, 269 rented unfurnished, 90 rented from employer.
